alert.note: Alert for Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 9:41PM MST until January 18 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations generally between 2 and 6 inches with higher amounts of 5 to 10 inches in the Jemez mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass, Jemez Mountains, Upper Rio Grande Valley, Southwest Mountains, West Central Mountains, and West Central Plateau. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST Tuesday Night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.

area.areaDesc: Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Jemez Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains; West Central Plateau
